description: This course offers a basic study of motor skill acquisition and motor control. Topics include methods of assessment, evaluation and research in the areas of motor learning and control, the learning environment, and discussion of factors that influence the acquisition and performance of motor skills. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing and completion of BIO 143 and BIO 243.
name: Top: Motor Control and Learning
notes: Open only to rising juniors and seniors.
Prerequisite: completion of BIO 143 and BIO 243.
prerequisites: junior or senior standing and completion of BIO 143 and BIO 243.
title: Topics in Kinesiology
